text:
Situation A. Patterns in the Ferris Wheel Cycles

Students in Ms. Keusch's class observed some patterns in the number of seconds it takes to be at the bottom again. Decide if the conjectures are true, false, or sometimes true. Provide evidence for your choice.

Conjecture 1

The amount of time when both are at the bottom is a common multiple of each of the two revolution times.

Conjecture 2

The amount of time when both are at the bottom is equal to the time taken by one of the Ferris wheels to go around.

Conjecture 3

The amount of time when both are at the bottom is the product of the two revolution times.

Situation B. Hanks Adds New Cards

Hank sees an opportunity to add cards to his Algebra Connections game using the idea of LCM. N is a whole number.

What answers would Hank write on the back of each card?
